intro: Hibbertia ancistrotricha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Hibbertia ancistrotricha is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers bloom in spring and are often visited by native bees and birds.
